intro: Chaerophyllum novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and streambanks. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in the lower South Island and Stewart Island. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in New Zealand.
